description.value: Common Designation Codes used across the FHIR eco-system

definition.value: A designation for the concept that uses informal, common words and phrases about health. it may include jargon, slang, ambiguous, and even misspelled words as used by consumers, and health care professionals communicating with patients. These designations are designed for use in consumer-facing applications. They may be vague and or ambiguous with regard to other consumer friendly designations for other concepts
This designation is the preferred designation for the specified language. Note that the 'display' for the code is the preferredForLanguage designation in the language of the resource
